item.title: Ayla add a quote by Jacqueline Carey
item.description: "That which yields is not always weak." -- Jacqueline Carey

item.title: Ayla add a quote by Jacqueline Carey
Ayla add a quote by Dr. Wayne Dyer
item.description: "Your reputation is in the hands of others. That's what the reputation is. You can't control that. The only thing you can control is your character." -- Dr. Wayne Dyer

item.title: Ayla add a quote by Moliere
item.description: "Trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit." -- Moliere

item.title: Ayla add a quote by Tom Kane
item.description: "A word can change a mind, a sentence can change a life and a book can change the world." -- Tom Kane

item.title: Ayla add a quote by Ann Druyan
item.description: "When my [author:husband|10538] died, because he was so famous and known for not being a believer, many people would come up to me-it still sometimes happens-and ask me if [author:Carl|10538] changed at the end and converted to a belief in an afterlife. They also frequently ask me if I think I will see him again. [author:Carl|10538] faced his death with unflagging courage and never sought refuge in illusions. The tragedy was that we knew we would never see each other again. I don't ever expect to be reunited with [author:Carl|10538]. But, the great thing is that when we were together, for nearly twenty years, we lived with a vivid appreciation of how brief and precious life is. We never trivialized the meaning of death by pretending it was anything other than a final parting. Every single moment that we were alive and we were together was miraculous-not miraculous in the sense of inexplicable or supernatural. We knew we were beneficiaries of chance. . . . That pure chance could be so generous and so kind. . . . That we could find each other, as [author:Carl|10538] wrote so beautifully in Cosmos, you know, in the vastness of space and the immensity of time. . . . That we could be together for twenty years. That is something which sustains me and itâ€™s much more meaningful. . . . The way he treated me and the way I treated him, the way we took care of each other and our family, while he lived. That is so much more important than the idea I will see him someday. <b>I don't think I'll ever see [author:Carl|10538] again. But I saw him. We saw each other. We found each other in the cosmos, and that was wonderful</b>." -- Ann Druyan

item.title: Ayla add a quote by Ann Druyan
item.description: "Interviewer: Didn't [author:Sagan|10538] want to believe? Druyan: [author:he|10538] didn't want to believe. [author:he|10538] wanted to know." -- Ann Druyan

item.title: Ayla add a quote by Jhumpa Lahiri
item.description: "That's the thing about books. They let you travel without moving your feet." -- Jhumpa Lahiri
